attributes.action: Stop policing people for speech that does not constitute a crime
attributes.additional_details:
Woman arrested for misgendering: https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-6687123/Mother-arrested-children-calling-transgender-woman-man.html?ito=social-twitter_dailymailUK

Police check a man's thinking: https://www.hulldailymail.co.uk/news/hull-east-yorkshire-news/humberside-police-twitter-transgender-limerick-2468385

Free speech in the UK should be covered by the following referenced Lord's bill (unless this has since been amended): https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1986/64/section/29J
attributes.background: Restricting speech is a slippery slope and while it is justifiable to criminalise incitement to hate, violence or terrorism, restricting free speech on opinions that hurt feelings is dangerous, a step in the direction of a totalitarian state and potentially silences legitimate debate.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because this is an operational decision for the police and not the UK Government or Parliament.

Operational policing is the responsibility of Police and Crime Commissioners. You can find out who your local Commissioner is here:

https://www.gov.uk/police-and-crime-commissioners
